Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 95f49937b8d4246974cf40d6d134e61e29c6eff4
This plus the other patch worked for me.
value is unsigned
Done. Thank you a lot.
move to after line 277
Done
Done
why we need to reset after every read ?

As you can see the commit msg describes, resetting to the hwmon file will cause the driver to write to the reset bit in the BMC register which handles intrusion. They haven't upstreamed the driver yet but it's here https://github.com/AspeedTech-BMC/linux/blob/aspeed-master-v5.15/drivers/hwmon/aspeed-chassis.c. And you can check out the register CHAI10 in Aspeed2600 datasheet.
if more than one path is found , only the 1st path is considered ?

Yes, I expect it to have only one path because the configuration in the aspeed-g6.dtsi points to the exact address of the register, I think configuration in dts files to use it won't cause any difference. Please help suggest a change if my understanding is not correct.
const ? or does the name changes
It doesn't change for now.
We might want to make this configurable - the hwmon label. There are other BMC chips or aspeed can make changes in the driver

Is it suitable to make users be aware of what's in the driver? I think if there's a change in the name, we have to modify this string from dbus-sensors because it corresponds to the driver. Would it be OK to change "Class" to "Aspeed2600_Hwmon" instead to separate this from implementations of other chips? If making hwmonName configurable is better, can you please recommend a config in the schema for it?

My idea was to have a "Label" field in the config for this sensor type and different drivers are supported by different configs. 
Having said that, I am ok with define a constexpr and improve later when we want to expand the support to other drivers

Sure, we can use something similar to this 
https://github.com/openbmc/dbus-sensors/blob/master/src/FanMain.cpp#L66

I am also OK with check in for the Aspeed support first as long as state clearly the limitation and how would one extend it to other drivers.
I added compatibleHwmonNames map to get the hwmonName for any Class string which has "Hwmon" in it and left instructions for future extension. Please check this out.
Thanks, looks good to me
Thanks a lot for your review.
Can we use 1 fstream file to read/write Hwmon file? I see that you are using 2 ifstream/ofstream file to read/write hwmon file

I don't know why it didn't fail when I forgott to close the ifstream before constructing the ofstream (it did fail when the file is a normal file, not a sysfs file). Changed to use fstream for cleaner code.
LGTM
